summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter, written on behalf of an anonymous client (referred to as 'Victim' or 'Doe'), requests the production of documentary and tangible evidence held by the DOJ relating to the client's sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein from 2006 to 2013. The evidence is sought to support the client's civil litigation and her claim before the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC who is a signatory on the Touhy request letter seeking evidence for a client who is a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: J. Stanley Pottinger

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the 'prolific pedophile' who sexually assaulted the client from 2006 to 2013. The requested evidence relates to his actions and communications.

connections.description: Edwards is an attorney representing the anonymous victim in her civil claims and in making this evidence request to the government.
Henderson is an attorney representing the anonymous victim, as a co-signatory on the request letter.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused and assaulted the victim from 2006 through 2013, starting when she was twenty.
Indyke is a defendant in a related SDNY lawsuit, suggesting a legal or financial association with Epstein's activities.

events.title: Start of Abuse Allegations
events.description: The document alleges that Jeffrey Epstein began sexually abusing the victim (Doe) around this time, when she was twenty years old.

events.title: End of Abuse Allegations
events.description: The document alleges the period of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein against the victim (Doe) continued until approximately this year.

events.title: Submission of Touhy Request
events.description: The date the formal written request for evidence is submitted by Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, Third Floor, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY)
keyFacts: The document is a formal legal request (Touhy Request) for the U.S. Department of Justice to produce evidence related to a specific victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The victim, proceeding anonymously as 'Doe', alleges she was sexually abused by Epstein from 2006 through 2013, beginning when she was 20 years old.
The requested evidence includes photographs, videos, correspondence, records of gifts/payments, and shipping records linking Epstein to the victim.
The evidence is sought to support the victim's civil litigation and her claim with the established Epstein Victim Compensation Program.
The request cites SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07772, which names Darren K. Indyke as a defendant, connecting this request to broader litigation related to Epstein.
